---
title: Getting Started
---

# Getting Started

Follow the instructions below to install PromptDX in your app.

## Install PromptDX

Install with npm:

```bash npm
npm install @puzzlet/promptdx
```

or yarn:

```bash npm
yarn add @puzzlet/promptdx
```

## Create your first Prompt

`index.prompt.mdx`
```jsx
---
name: basic-prompt
metadata:
  model:
    name: gpt-4o-mini
---

<User>Hello World</User>
```

## Run your Prompt

### VSCode

Run .prompt.mdx files directly within your VSCode editor.

[Download the VSCode Extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=puzzlet.promptdx)

### SDK - Loader (Recommended):

Use our [webpack loader](https://github.com/puzzlet-ai/promptdx-loader). Then import your prompt directly.

```tsx
import { runInference } from '@puzzlet/promptdx';
import MyPrompt from './index.prompt.mdx';
...
const props = { name: 'Jim' };
const result = await runInference(MyPrompt, props);
```

### SDK - Node

```tsx
import { parse, transform, stringify } from '@puzzlet/promptdx';
import fs from 'fs';

// Define how to load imports.
const getFile = (path: string) => {
  const input = fs.readFileSync(path, 'utf-8');
  return input;
}

const run = async () => {
  const mdx = await getFile('index.prompt.mdx');
  const parsed = await parse(mdx, `${basePathToMdxFile}`, getFile);
  const props = { name: 'Jim' };
  const result = await runInference(parsed, props);
}
```
